SENT.plain: Chagas disease, caused by the parasite Trypanosoma cruzi, is an important cause of cardiac disease in endemic areas of Latin America
It is now being diagnosed in nonendemic areas because of immigration
Typical cardiac manifestations of Chagas disease include dilated cardiomyopathy, congestive heart failure, arrhythmias, cardioembolism, and stroke
Clinical and laboratory-based research to define the pathology resulting from T. cruzi infection has shed light on many of the cellular and molecular mechanisms leading to these manifestations
Antiparasitic treatment may not be appropriate for patients with advanced cardiac disease
Clinical management of Chagas heart disease is similar to that used for cardiomyopathies caused by other processes
Cardiac transplantation has been successfully performed in a small number of patients with Chagas heart disease
